intro: Dissotidendron polyanthum, commonly known as the Chinese flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern China. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its showy, bright red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that turn yellow in the fall before shedding. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, aiding in its propagation. The tree is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
